skill.name: literature-review
skill.description: Conduct comprehensive, systematic literature reviews using multiple academic databases (PubMed, arXiv, bioRxiv, Semantic Scholar, etc.). This skill should be used when conducting systematic literature reviews, meta-analyses, research synthesis, or comprehensive literature searches across biomedical, scientific, and technical domains. Creates professionally formatted markdown documents and PDFs with verified citations in multiple citation styles (APA, Nature, Vancouver, etc.).

security_audit.summary: All 172 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The static analyzer misidentified documentation examples in markdown files as security threats. Markdown code blocks showing example commands were flagged as 'Ruby/shell backtick execution'. Academic terms like 'MeSH' were flagged as 'weak cryptographic algorithms'. Boolean search operators were flagged as 'system reconnaissance'. The actual Python scripts (generate_pdf.py, search_databases.py, verify_citations.py) use safe patterns: subprocess calls with hardcoded arguments, HTTP requests to legitimate academic APIs (CrossRef, DOI), and file writes to user-specified paths. This is a genuine literature review tool with no malicious code.

content.value_statement: Researchers spend hours searching multiple databases and verifying citations manually. This skill streamlines literature reviews by searching academic databases, deduplicating results, verifying citations against CrossRef, and generating professional PDFs with proper formatting.
actual_capabilities: Search and aggregate results from multiple academic databases including PubMed, arXiv, bioRxiv, and Semantic Scholar
Deduplicate search results automatically by DOI or title with smart detection
Verify DOIs and retrieve metadata from CrossRef API with automatic citation formatting
Generate professional PDF documents using pandoc and xelatex with multiple styles
Apply citation styles including APA, Nature, Vancouver, Chicago, and IEEE automatically
Create structured literature review documents using included templates with PRISMA guidance
limitations: Requires external tools (pandoc, xelatex) to be installed for PDF generation
Does not directly access databases; works with exported search results from other tools
Citation verification depends on CrossRef API availability and data quality
Cannot access subscription-only databases without proper credentials configured

prompt_templates.title: Basic search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for recent research on [TOPIC] using the literature-review skill. Search PubMed, arXiv, and bioRxiv for papers from 2020-2024.

prompt_templates.title: Systematic review
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a systematic literature review on [RESEARCH_QUESTION] following PRISMA guidelines. Use the literature-review skill to search databases, deduplicate results, and create a review document.

prompt_templates.title: Citation check
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify all citations in my_literature_review.md using the verify_citations.py script. Generate a citation report and format verified citations in APA style.

prompt_templates.title: PDF export
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a professional PDF of my literature review using the literature-review skill with Nature citation style and table of contents.

output_examples.input: Conduct a systematic literature review on CRISPR gene therapy for sickle cell disease
output: PRISMA flow diagram showing search and screening process
Thematic synthesis organized by delivery methods (viral vectors, lipid nanoparticles)
Verified citations in Nature format with DOI verification
Quality assessment using Cochrane Risk of Bias tool
Professional PDF with table of contents and section numbering

best_practices: Search at least 3 complementary databases to ensure comprehensive coverage of the literature
Document all search strings, dates, and result counts for reproducibility and transparency
Verify all citations before finalizing to catch broken DOIs and incorrect metadata
anti_patterns: Using only a single database search will miss relevant papers published elsewhere
Skipping deduplication leads to duplicate counting and inflated results in your review
Ignoring preprints means missing the latest unpublished findings in fast-moving fields

faq.question: Which databases can I search?
faq.answer: PubMed via gget, bioRxiv/medRxiv, arXiv, Semantic Scholar API, and specialized biomedical databases like ChEMBL, UniProt, and KEGG.

faq.question: What citation styles are supported?
faq.answer: APA (7th), Nature, Vancouver, Chicago (Author-Date), and IEEE styles with automatic formatting from verified metadata.

faq.question: How does citation verification work?
faq.answer: The script extracts DOIs from your document, queries CrossRef API to verify they exist, and retrieves correct metadata for formatting.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally on your files. Only DOI metadata is fetched from CrossRef. No research data is sent elsewhere.

faq.question: Why is PDF generation failing?
faq.answer: Ensure pandoc and xelatex are installed. Run generate_pdf.py --check-deps to verify dependencies. Install with brew or apt as documented.

faq.question: How does this compare to reference managers?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on the review workflow (search, synthesis, verification) rather than personal library management. Use with Zotero or Mendeley for reference storage.
